text: [Music]
hello I'm Daisy a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney I'm
going to show you how to add tags to
your AWS resources to separate the
entries in your bill by cost center or
project let's get
started tags are key and value PS that
can help you organize your AWS resour
resources into groups tags can help you
manage identify and search for and
filter your AWS resources when you apply
tags to your resources you can see the
tagged resources all in one place as
resource groups you can also use cost
Explorer and Conant usage reports to
view billing information about your
tagged resources and you can use AWS
budgets to send notifications about
spending limits related to specific tags
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the tag editor
console for Regions select all the
regions that apply for resource types
select the required resources leave the
tags field empty for now choose search
resources the results are visible at the
bottom half of the
page for my example I want to add tags
with keys such as project cost center
and
environment choose the top checkbox to
select all the visible resources and
then choose manage tags of selected
resources now choose add tag to start
adding the tag
Keys note that tag keys and values are
case sensitive choose add tag and enter
c
Center choose add tag and enter
environment choose review and apply tag
changes after you review the changes
choose apply changes to all
selected choose search resources to get
the result again now let's add values to
these keys to help organize the
resources there are a couple of ways to
do this depending on whether you want to
add the same values to multiple
resources or to just a few to add values
to multiple resources at the same time
choose the individual check boxes to
select the required resources and then
choose manage tags of selected
resources enter the value in the tag
value column note that if the tag value
column presents a drop- down list with
options you can still enter a new value
however your new value will replace the
keys existing values for that resource
choose review and apply tag changes
after you review the changes choose
apply changes to all selected choose
search resources to get the result again
if you want to add unique tag values for
individual resources choose preferences
which is the gear icon on the right side
of the search results turn on the
required tag keys by using the toggle
buttons choose
confirm your tag key now appear as
columns in the search results
table locate the tag key for the
resource and choose the field to edit
each tag
value so now you know how to add tags to
your AWS resources to separate the
entries in your bill by cost center or
project thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
